subject: Boxing
lead_paragraph: Bernard Hopkins told everyone who would listen that he had a foolproof plan for getting inside Winky Wright’s vaunted defense.On Saturday night, the 42-year-old Hopkins ended Wright’s seven-and-a-half-year, 13-bout unbeaten streak with a unanimous decision in their 170-pound matchup at the Mandalay Bay Events Center in Las Vegas.Hopkins (48-4-1,32 knockouts) landed his biggest blow when he opened a gash over Wright’s left eye with a head butt in the third round. Hopkins spent the night picking at it while Wright (51-4-1) scrambled and counterpunched, his face showing frustration and fatigue as the fight slipped away.Hopkins abandoned retirement for a shot at the 35-year-old Wright, who had not lost since December 1999.
